Roy "Chubby" Brown (born 3 February 1945) is an
English stand-up comedian, famous for his
Sarcastic BLUE Humour. The controversial nature
of his act means he rarely appears on major
television channels, and Brown has attracted
Accusations that his Comedy style is outdated
whilst simultaneously being described as "the most
important Comedian of the past 25 years".

infoxd.png
Date of Birth 5 February 1945, Grangetown, Middlesbrough, England, UK
Birth Name	Royston Vasey
Nickname	Chubs

His act is so controversial he has never been allowed
to perform on TV, apart from once on the UK satellite
channel Men and Motors - but this was heavily edited.
Fans wishing to seek out his material must either buy
a ticket for a live gig or buy a video/audio cassette
of Britain's self-proclaimed 'rudest, lewdest comedian.'.

Roy 'Chubby' Brown was born on February 5, 1945 in
Grangetown, Middlesbrough, England as Royston Vasey.
He is a writer and actor, known for U.F.O. (1993),
Roy Chubby Brown: Thunder B*!!*cks (2000) and
Roy Chubby Brown: Clitoris Allsorts - Live at
Blackpool (1995).

Trade Mark:

Wears a patchwork suit and a flying helmet
Usually comes out to his shows to the
Beastie Boys Fight for Your Right to Party
anthem as his fans chant 'you fat bastard'
over and over as he dances around twirling
his fingers, twisting his feet and pointing
at himself.

Trivia:

His birth name, Royston Vasey, is the name of the
fictional village where The League of Gentlemen
(1999) is set. He makes an appearance in the second
series of this dark comedy.
Son Reece born, making him a father again at the age
of 56.
He Underwent an operation and overcame throat cancer
